text:
RICHMOND-S/S
MERIT 100'S REG. S.P. Effective Date: February 1, 1979
760 (PC)

CIGARETTE DESCRIPTIVE FOR MERIT 100'S REGULAR S.P.
(31. 5mm Filter)

Lehgeh ~ 99.5am COPY

Circumference ~ 24.8mm

Filter - 31,5mm

z

 

te Rod:
Filler - High Burley - Basic Merit K.8. Formula
Cuts = 30/Inch

Paper - Ecusta 753/Schweitzer 110-6; 27.0um x 6500m; P.M. Material Code 10-111-A
or DeMauduit Ref. 110-6; 27.0um x 6500m; P.M. Material Code 10-154-A

 

Print Die - Machine Number
Ink - J.M, Fry Type 1-376, MARK VIII; P.M. Material Code 60-906-A

“OR QA. AP! L
Circumference - 24.8um

Length - 68.0um

Cigarette:

‘Tipping - 72mm (60mm Cork, 12mm White) x 2700m Triple Gold Line, Black Copy,
Preprinted; P.M, Material Code 12-690-A

Tipping Adhesive - Fuller 3985; P.M, Material Code 60-285-A -OR Q.A. APPROVED EQUAL
Rod Moisture - 12.65%

Total R.T.D. = 4.9 inches of water - Diluted
6.0 inches of water - Undiluted

Plug R.T.D. - 4.3 inches of water - Undiluted

Diluted with needle insert in rolling block giving .six (6) perforated hole:
in one line penetrating into filter.

Dilution Target - 30% + 5% (Median of six (6) individual cigarette readings)

Prepared By: Glenn £. Barnett
Approved By:

Jaya
This supersedes specification dated January 22, 1979. Reason for change:

Moisture target changed.
9021219005

‘Operations Services
